ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:0.5_0: 46. The training rule on stuffing the cheeks
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate stuffing their cheeks. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat stuffing my cheeks,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.4_0: he should not eat stuffing the cheeks;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats stuffing one or both cheeks, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.15_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
